intro: Sida rhombifolia var. ovata, commonly known as the broadleaf sida, is a flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its ovate, broad leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in loose inflorescences. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. The species is also known for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of fiber.
